customer_reviews.title: Not recommended based on personal experience with product and customer service.

customer_reviews.title: Never Froze the ingredients
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I'd be writing a one star review, especially for such an expensive piece of equipment, but I should have payed attention to all the other negative reviews with the same problem. This machine would cool to a maximum of -7 degrees F and then quickly heat up to room temperature as soon as the (chilled) ingredients were added. It would remain at 48 F for an hour until it was apparent that this machine was defective. I guess buying this is a 50/50 gamble on whether or not it will actually arrive in working condition. Don't take your chances.

customer_reviews.title: This machine is a superior ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a superior ice cream maker. I have made blackberry sorbet, peach sorbet, and chocolate ice cream using my own recipes, but following their guidelines.Perfect every time. The only unclear item in the guide book is the use of the pre-cool. It simply cools the machine so that you don't risk warming up your already cooled mix while waiting for the machine to get down to temperature. This is important in my house in the summer as we have no a/c. The machine is easy to clean. The instructions are pretty clear. Go ahead and indulge yourself and buy this machine. You will be happy you did (not to mention weightier).

customer_reviews.title: The ice cream is good right when you remove it
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient, but the blade turns too slowly to whip air into the ice cream and make it fluffy. The ice cream is good right when you remove it, but not hard at that point, so more like soft-serve. It's good an hour or two later, but then it just gets harder and harder each day it's in the freezer. They need to come up with a way of changing the blade shape or increasing the speed of the blade's rotation in order to whip air into the ice cream to give it a fluffy consistency. This is a problem with all these home ice cream makers, but for this amount of money one would expect a better solution.

customer_reviews.title: Too easy to make ice cream!
customer_reviews.text: This ice cream maker is dangerous. You can basically make ice cream every day with out the wait. The first day I received it I made ice cream. Then again the following two days. Making ice cream is so easy and it's ready within an hour. It is very easy to program for the type of dessert you want to make. It makes roughly 1-1/2 quarts which about the right size for me since I'm the only one who eats it. Hubby doesn't eat it. More for me!
customer_reviews.author: Babs54

customer_reviews.title: It's a great product, but the plastic top came broken in ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product, but the plastic top came broken in the box I am going to contact them and see if I can get a new top sorted out .
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellence machine very convenient and easy to use all complemented with its good looking shape
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Cordoba

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This Piece of Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 2 of these machines and they both malfunctioned. On the 1st one the compressor did not work, we spent all day trying to make ice cream. I tried again with another new machine and with the 2nd one the motor did not work. We wasted hours and $ for all the ingredients trying to make ice crème, additionally my daughter who was so excited to make it was disappointed twice!
customer_reviews.author: Steven C. Loquet

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!!!! The compressor doesn't work for anything. It barely could get cold at first and then broke after the first use. On top of that they refuse to let me return it! Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Rizza

customer_reviews.title: Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Nice, sturdy, *heavy* design. Too bad mine doesn't work. (Seems to run but won't cool down at all.) I'll try my luck with support, but at $400 I'd expected better. Shouldn't have planned on using this the day after arrival. Ugh. What a let down.
customer_reviews.author: John Paul Barringer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately does not work at all, so I don't know how it works. I was very disappointed after having my mix ready and the ice cream maker didn't start. Hope that solves my problem Breville. .
customer_reviews.author: marisol

customer_reviews.title: Another Clunker Lands on Someone's Doorstep
customer_reviews.text: Put me down as another person receiving a defective unit. First, the machine never cooled past -7F on "pre-cool". Second, on the first and second batches (I didn't make any more), after the "add mix-ins" alert and mix-ins are added (not many, and not large pieces), the machine sounds like a motorcycle revving in the kitchen non-stop and the paddle stops turning. The ice cream was alternating between "frozen yogurt" and "gelato" on the display, actually reversing back down a couple of times. I'm trying one more time before buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: An Appliance & Healthfood Junkie

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. Up until today, I was using the recipe with sweetened condensed milk. It was so easy and delicious. Tonight I used my Vitamix to make a custard. I did not need to do all the steps you see in the videos. I just put all the ingredients in the Vitamix and turned it on for 7 minutes. While that was running, I pre cooled the Breville. I was able to put the mixture right in and start the ice cream. Delicious!! I have not tried Gelato yet.
customer_reviews.author: I never ask questions

customer_reviews.title: Fails too quickly for the price
customer_reviews.text: This would be an excellent product if it were more rugged. Even after light use - once every week or two max - the product quickly reaches a point where it just cannot "churn" effectively. If you don't mind a huge cost per serving, buy this product. You can get very innovative with homemade ice cream. Just plan to purchase a replacement every so many operation cycles. Otherwise. Settle for store bought ice cream. No matter the price, it will be MUCH, MUCH less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Good
customer_reviews.text: While we are going to keep it, the only complaint this family has is even on the hardest setting, the ice cream is not "hard". It had to go into our freezer for a good hour to be really ice cream and not soft serve. But it is so easy to use and it makes the right amount for desert for 4. Have not tried anything other than ice cream, no sure how gelato will be. We will try it next
customer_reviews.author: D Sal

customer_reviews.title: Great product but ice cream is too soft initially and sharp tub edge can cut finger
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. We tried another machine that didn’t work well and then got this one and it works really well. My only issue is that the ice cream when it’s fully done (hardest setting) is soft and you have to leave it overnight in the freezer before you can really eat it. The other thing is that the metal container is sharp on the outer edge and when you’re scooping out the ice cream after you make it it cuts my finger little bit every time
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

product_meta.title: Breville BCI600XL Smart Scoop Ice Cream Maker
product_meta.description: The BCI600XL Smart Scoop is Breville's easy to use ice cream maker with automatic hardness settings. It's the first ice cream maker that automatically senses the hardness of the mixture based on your selection and keeps it ready until it's time to serve. The Breville BCI600XL Smart Scoop is made of BPA free materials, features a child lock, and when your dessert is ready will sound an alert beep or one of three musical tunes.
